actions.text: Referred to House Committee on the Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide for the issuance of nonimmigrant visas to certain aliens entering the United States to perform services or labors of a temporary or seasonal nature unless specific contracts of employment; and to require an immigrant alien to maintain a permanent residence as a condition for entering and remaining as an immigrant of the United States.

summary.text: Immigration and Nationality Act Amendments - Permits, under the Immigration and Nationality Act, the issuance of nonimmigrant visas to aliens who have no intention of abandonment of their country of residence, and who enter the United States to perform services or labor of a seasonal nature under contracts of employment. Sets forth conditions for such labor contracts required to meet the visa allowances under this Act. Revises the present provison of law relating to the present condition that unemployed persons capable of performing services covered by labor contracts cannot be found in this country. Requires an immigrant alien to maintain a permanent residence as a condition for entering and remaining as an immigrant of the United States. (Amends 8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(20)).

titles.title: A bill to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to provide for the issuance of nonimmigrant visas to certain aliens entering the United States to perform services or labors of a temporary or seasonal nature unless specific contracts of employment; and to require an immigrant alien to maintain a permanent residence as a condition for entering and remaining as an immigrant of the United States.
